meanings.definition: To have a substantial effect or influence
meanings.sent1: The rainy weather can militate against outdoor activities.
meanings.sent2: His hard work will militate positively on his grades.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel militated against the bird feeder's security measures.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude militated against the negative vibes in the room.
meanings.sent5: The bright colors militated against the dullness of the room.

meanings.definition: To be a powerful or conclusive factor in preventing or affecting something
meanings.sent1: The lack of evidence will militate against his case in court.
meanings.sent2: The strong winds could militate against our plans for a picnic.
meanings.sent3: The cat's playful antics militated against the seriousness of the meeting.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness militated against finding a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The loud noise militated against her ability to concentrate.
